column3:
See https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/199

I like the other pull's approach better because times in bitcoin are fuzzy-- transactions take on the time of the block that they're included in, and will change as block-chain re-orgs happen.
How do we know which transactions belong in which block, in order for us to call listsinceblock with the correct block?\n
Ah ok, he's returning the block id as well. When are you integrating this?\n
Consensus seems to be pull 199 is a better approach.  I'm going to close this.\n
